intro: Cycnium sandersonii, commonly known as the sanderson's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate and often have a distinctive lobed shape. Cycnium sandersonii is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
